CatDescriptText: Mr. L.N. Berkeley, treasurer of a charitable organization, Mt. Lebanon, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 9, 1961, pg. 5 with question: "Do you think that in the final analysis, the uncommitted darker nations will join the democratic (pro-Western) or Communistic bloc?  Why?" answer reads: "I believe they finally will join the democratic nations, because the uncommitted countries will see that they have to suffer with the democratic nations if the nuclear bomb keeps being made."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of L.N. Berkeley wearing flecked suit jacket, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of window; Portrait of man wearing plaid necktie, moustache, and hat, standing in front of brick building with awning
